article_text: The latest trend in smartphones are extenders called selfie sticks that allow the user to hold their device as much as three feet away, giving their ego photos a wider view of that landmark or artwork in the background. Art museums in bigger cities are banning them. Galleries here say it is not a problem — yet.

article_metadata.news-keywords: news, Kansas City, selfie sticks, museums, art, galleries, nelson-atkins, nearman museum, kansas city art institute
article_metadata.title: Art museums are on the watch for the rise of ‘selfie sticks’ | The Kansas City Star

article_summary:
Galleries here say it is not a problem — yet.
The latest trend in smartphones are extenders called selfie sticks that allow the user to hold their device as much as three feet away, giving their ego photos a wider view of that landmark or artwork in the background.
Art museums in bigger cities are banning them.
